channel.title: Posts on Jamvie: CTF writeups and more
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Jamvie: CTF writeups and more

item.title: AngstromCTF 2020: UBI
item.description: This challenge was easily one of the most complex ones I came across. It was so complex, in fact, I didn’t end up solving it during the CTF, I had finished it 3 days after.

item.title: Commonly Used Software
item.description: I really like web-based exploits, so I focus primarily on the web challenges when my team and I participate in CTFs.

item.title: PlaidCTF 2020: Contrived Web Problem
item.description: This was a CTF I unfortunately didn’t have the time for, as I was busy doing finals in April :(. My team let me know about this cool and unqiue problem, and I’m glad they did!

item.title: CONfidence 2020: CatWeb
item.description: I participated in CONfidence CTF 2020 teasers in March of this year. I was focusing mainly on this problem, and it really helped me broaden my skills in JSON-related attacks! I have never seen many JSON injections before this, so this was welcome practise.

item.title: UTCTF 2020: Epic Admin Pwn
item.description: I particpated in UTCTF with my team in March 2020, held and operated by the University of Texas ISSS. My team and I solved a very fun SQLi-based attack! This challenge helped me to refine my python skills cause the lord knows I needed it, as well as reinforced my knowledge about SQL-based attacks. This is the first web challenge I solved in the CTF, and admittedly the one that I enjoyed the most to do.

item.title: Jamvie's first post
item.description: Hi, and welcome to my CTF blog. I’m just a software dev with a hobby for CTFs, and I thought a blog would be a good way to stash all my long-archived writeups for CTF challenges I participated in. I’m by no means an expert on the topic, but if someone stumbles upon here and gains a newfound interest in cybersecurity, that would be pretty cool. Over the next few weeks I will upload my old writeups for some CTFs that occurred this year and last, so stay tuned!
